title: DevOps Research Metrics schema
description: A schema defining a standardized way of capturing data for DevOps metrics

metadata.description: Optional metadata to provide context for the data in the file

company.description: The name of the company associated with the data

releases.description: A list of information about code releases

release-id.description: An optional identifier for this release

timestamp.description: The date and time that the release occurred

changes.description: A list of code changes associated with the release

items.description: A single code change, often a git commit

timestamp.description: The date and time that the code change was committed to version control

change-id.description: An optional identifier for the code change; often a git commit SHA

service-incidents.description: A list of service incidents or defects related to this release that impacted users (e.g., lead to service impairment or service outage) and subsequently required remediation (e.g., require a hotfix, rollback, fix forward, patch)

items.description: An incident that resulted in degraded service for users

restore-timestamp.description: The date and time that service was restored

start-timestamp.description: An optional start date and time for the incident; if none if provided, then the release timestamp should be used as the incident start

incident-id.description: An optional identifier for the incident. For example, a JIRA issue id.
